title: Muiravonside Country Park Walking Route

images.title: Mike Smith, CC BY 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The parish contains Muiravonside Country Park which is 170 acres of woodland. It is situated in the south-east corner of the area of Falkirk. It has a trail which features this teasel based sculpture as photographed by Mike Smith.

images.title: Mike Smith, CC BY 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Sculpture in the park

images.title: Mike Smith, CC BY 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Buzzard perched on a branch. This parish takes its name from the river Avon, which divides the counties of Linlithgow and Stirling. It is situated in the latter, although it belongs to the presbytery of Linlithgow, and the Synod of Lothian.

images.title: Mike Smith, CC BY 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Goosanders

images.title: Mike Smith, CC BY 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Owl Sculpture by Jonny Stableford

images.title: C L T Smith / Dovecote at Muiravonside Country Park
images.caption: Dovecote

images.title: Eileen Henderson / Lime kiln in Muiravonside Country Park
images.caption: Lime kiln

description: Explore 170 acres of woodland and parkland in this park near Grangemouth. There are a network of paths taking you around the woodland, parkland, gardens and riverside. Highlights in the park include the River Avon, a spectacular river gorge and the historic Avon Aqueduct. The park contains an excellent visitor centre in the old farmhouse. Muiravonside is located just a couple of miles from Linlithgow and about five miles from Falkirk. One good option is to follow the Union Canal from the centre of Linlithgow to the park - a walk of about 2.5 miles. You could then visit Linlithgow Loch and enjoy more waterside walking. Also nearby is the splendid Beecraigs Country Park. Here you can try the Lochcote Reservoir and Cockleroy Hill Walk and enjoy some splendid views over the Bathgate Hills.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Just south of Falkirk there's the lovely Callendar Park. The 14th century French chateau styled house is surrounded by lovely parkland and woodland with a fascinating museum and a Roman Antonine Wall to see.

display_address: Avon Aqueduct, Union Canal Towpath, Whitecross, Falkirk, Alba / Scotland, EH49 6LS, United Kingdom
